articles.title: California attorney general declines to join Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI
articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.summary: California's attorney general's office declined to join a lawsuit by Elon Musk against OpenAI. Musk wants to remove the nonprofit board as its controlling power in exchange for a valuable equity stake. Musk and Sam Altman cofounded ChatGPT maker OpenAI in 2015 but Musk left before the company became a technology star.

articles.title: Rancho Mirage Chamber of Commerce Set to Host AI Luncheon
articles.author: Contributing Editor
articles.summary: The Rancho Mirage Chamber of Commerce will host a luncheon Wednesday focused on the impact of artificial intelligence on local businesses. The event will be held from 11 a.m to 1:30 p.m. at the Mission Hills Country Club, 34600 Mission Hills Drive. It will include speakers Jordan Crenshaw, the senior vice president at the U.S. Chamber's Technology Engagement Center, and Andrew McCauley of Visit Greater Palm Springs and Flashlight Marketing.

articles.title: ChatGPT now has a library for all of your AI-generated images
articles.summary: OpenAI launched a new library for ChatGPT on Tuesday. It's rolling out to all Free, Plus, and Pro users on mobile and the web. OpenAI is in the process of rolling the new feature out so check back tomorrow on the web if you can't find it today.

articles.title: AIML Announces Closing of Oversubscribed Private Placement
articles.author: Pharmiweb
articles.summary: AI/ML Innovations Inc. completed its previously announced non-brokered private placement. The Company's shares are listed on CSE:AIML, OTCQX and FWB:42FB and it has a market value of $15.5 million.

articles.title: ChatGPT Action Figure: DIY Guide & Trend Explained
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: The ChatGPT image generator, powered by the advanced GPT-40 model, has become a popular tool for creating AI-generated action figures. The trend has become popular in the U.S. as people are drawn to the novelty of seeing themselves immortalized as a collectible toy. It has also become a vehicle for satire, with political figures like Donald Trump, Elon Musk, Vladimir Putin, Kamala Harris and Bernie Sanders being depicted.

articles.title: OpenAI names members to its nonprofit commission
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI named members to its newly formed nonprofit commission. The commission will guide the company's philanthropic efforts. Microsoft-backed OpenAI in December outlined a plan to create a public benefit corporation to manage its growing business. Elon Musk sued the AI startup and its CEO, Sam Altman.

articles.title: AI pilot program introduced in Jamaican schools
articles.author: Sheri-Kae Mcleod
articles.summary: The Ministry of Education, Skills, Youth and Information has launched a series of ambitious initiatives aimed at transforming Jamaica's education system. Artificial intelligence (AI) is playing a central role in the overhaul. The government is expanding its investment in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education. Six new STEM schools will be built across the country. Jamaica's first state-of-the-art AI lab will launch this year.

articles.title: Local AI sales tool processes $800 million in 6 months
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Revwit is a new AI-powered sales assistant launched in November 2024. It processes over $800 million in business-to-business transactions in 6 months. It is managed by a local AI team based in the U.S. and runs on AI technology.

articles.title: AI-powered surgery is improving patient care
articles.author: Gabriel Jones
articles.summary: By 2030, more than 313 million surgical procedures will be done annually. The current healthcare system can't keep up with this demand. AI is transforming the way surgeons operate. It's improving surgical decision making and decreasing guesswork in the operating room. It also improves patient safety and outcomes.

articles.title: OpenAI names new nonprofit ‘advisors'
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Dolores Huerta, Monica Lozano, Dr. Robert K. Ross, and Jack Oliver have been appointed to a new nonprofit commission to help inform OpenAI's philanthropic efforts. Their appointment comes just months after OpenAI announced its plan to shift into a for-profit company.

articles.title: North Platte Community Playhouse's Town Hall Lecture Series guest speaks on cybersecurity
articles.author: Victoria Norgaard
articles.summary: Theresa Payton is the CEO and founder of Fortalice Solutions, a boutique cybersecurity and intelligence services company. She was the first female chief information officer for the White House during the President George W. Bush Administration. Payton talked about the pros and cons of artificial intelligence and how to regulate your own use of it.

articles.title: Is Microsoft (MSFT) the Best Machine Learning Stock to Buy Now?
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: The global machine-learning market is expected to grow at a 34.8% CAGR from 2023 to 2030. Amazon CEO Andy Jassy believes that the current AI operations are expensive due to chip costs and other factors. Jefferies analyst Brent Thill lowered the company's price target to $500 from $550 while maintaining a buy rating.

articles.title: ChatGPT now has a section for your AI-generated images
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI is adding an image library to ChatGPTP to make it easier to access AI-generated images. It's rolling out to all Free, Plus, and Pro users on mobile and on the web. I have the app on iOS and it works well.

articles.title: OpenAI's Reportedly Exploring its Own AI-Based Social Network
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking to build its own social media app focused on images created via its various image generation tools. It's unclear if it will be released as a separate app or integrate into ChatGPT, which became the most downloaded app globally last month. Elon Musk was an early investor in OpenAI, but he didn't see eye-to-eye with CEO Sam Altman. Musk created his own AI project, xAI, out of spite for the OpenAI team.

articles.title: OpenAI is quietly building the most powerful social app ever made
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: OpenAI is working on its own X-like social media network. An internal prototype exists with a social feed centered on ChatGPT's image-generation tools. CEO Sam Altman has been seeking external feedback on the project. If OpenAI goes all-in on this idea, it will bring the company into competition with Elon Musk and Meta. Mark Zuckerberg is defending Meta's dominance in court.

articles.title: New Survey Finds Aspiring Business Students Embrace Learning to Think Strategically--with Help from AI
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: GMAC's latest global survey of business school candidates finds increasing importance of ROI as the tech sector's lure fades. Nearly half of prospective students report artificial intelligence as part of their ideal curriculum. They want hands-on experience utilizing AI for strategy and decision-making.

articles.title: A.I. Action Figures Flood Social Media (Accessories Included)
articles.summary: ChatGPT created a Barbie-fied version of Anna Wintour and Ludwig van Beethoven using artificial intelligence. The trend has frustrated illustrators who oppose the use of unlicensed artwork to train these tools and are concerned about the effects of A.I. on their livelihood.

articles.title: ‘Human Made': Artists Push Back on A.I. Dolls and Action Figures
articles.author: Callie Holtermann
articles.summary: In recent weeks, social media users have been turning to A.I. to generate Barbie-fied versions of themselves, their dogs or their favorite famous figures. The trend has frustrated illustrators who oppose the use of unlicensed artwork to train artificial intelligence tools and are concerned about the effects on their livelihoods.

articles.title: Design of mural at Shenandoah University to honor veterans does not contain AI
articles.author: Rebecca Barnabi
articles.summary: Art students and alumni are unhappy with the use of artificial intelligence in a mural intended to honor veterans at Shenandoah University. The mural was designed by a third party and the project's sponsor confirmed that AI was not used. Aislinn Coghlan started a petition against the mural and it has nearly 400 signatures.

articles.title: Sam Altman at TED 2025: Inside the most uncomfortable — and important — AI interview of the year
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: OpenAI has 800 million weekly active users and is experiencing 'unbelievable' growth rates. The company recently closed a $40 billion funding round valuing it at $300 billion. Elon Musk has suggested Altman has been 'corrupted by the Ring of Power'

articles.title: Do Realistic AI Avatars Invoke the Uncanny Valley?
articles.author: Monica Cull
articles.summary: Researchers from the Center for Advanced Internet Studies in Bochum, Germany, conducted a study on the perception of AI-generated avatars of scientists on social media platforms like TikTok. The participants rated the avatars based on integrity, perceived competence, and benevolence. The results of the questionnaire favored realistic avatars over cartoonish ones.

articles.title: Northwestern Mutual Data Science Institute panel talks AI and workforce
articles.summary: The panel discussion was part of the Northwestern Mutual Data Science Institute's annual symposium. It focused on the realities and misconceptions surrounding AI and how technologies such as generative AI are reshaping the workforce. The Milwaukee Bucks and Fiserv Forum are focusing on upskilling their employees in AI.

articles.title: Gartner's 12 Emerging Tech Innovation Disruptors
articles.author: Esther Shein
articles.summary: Gartner's report highlights 12 early-stage innovations that will redefine industries and create new market frontiers. The list includes disinformation security, algorithm-aligned silicon, and hyper-synthetic data. Polyfunctional robots, domain-specific AI, and digital ethics are also on the list.

articles.title: No, Technology Doesn't Cause ‘Digital Dementia' in Older People
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: A new study from the University of Texas and Baylor University in the United States found no evidence for the 'digital dementia' hypothesis. It found the use of computers, smartphones and the internet among people over 50 might actually be associated with lower rates of cognitive decline. The study found that technology use had a similar positive effect on brain function as physical activity.

articles.title: Programmable photonic chip uses light to accelerate AI training and cut energy use
articles.author: Ian Scheffler
articles.summary: Penn Engineers have developed the first programmable chip that can train nonlinear neural networks using light. It could dramatically speed up AI training, reduce energy use and pave the way for fully light-powered computers. The team used the chip to solve benchmark AI problems with over 97% accuracy on a simple nonlinear decision boundary task and 96% on Iris flower data set.

articles.title: This Therapist Helped Clients Feel Better. It Was A.I.
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: In the first clinical trial of its kind, an A.I. chatbot eased mental health symptoms among participants. The technology may someday help solve the provider shortage, as it may help solve mental health problems.   Â   in the future.

articles.title: Google Launches Expanded AI Text-to-Video Generation Tools
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: Today, Google announced expanded access to its Veo 2 AI video generation model, which can generate 8-second videos from text prompts. Google is also adding video animation to its visual creations in Whisk, which creates graphic depictions of described scenes. Google says that video generation is rolling out to Gemini Advanced subscribers globally on web and mobile starting today and continuing over the next few weeks.

articles.title: State asks all officers to undergo AI training to improve governance
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Chief secretary Manoj Ahuja issued a directive on Tuesday, asking govt to mandate training on artificial intelligence for all its officers. It's a significant move towards digital transformation in governance in the state govt's view.      .

articles.title: Acer Debuts Nitro Gaming PCs Featuring Latest NVIDIA GeForce RTX 50 Series GPUs
articles.author: The Galveston Daily News
articles.summary: Acer's new Nitro AI laptops and Nitro 20 desktop offer solid performance and essential AI capabilities. New NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 graphics are supported by new NVIDIA GeForce GTX 5060 AI chips. Acer's new laptops are slim and have slim options and are available in black.

articles.title: South Carolina attorney general urges swift passage of bills designed to close child sexual exploitation loopholes
articles.author: Sophie Brams
articles.summary: There is a growing concern about how artificial intelligence is being used to exploit children. South Carolina already outlaws the possession, distribution, or production of child sexual abuse material (CSAM), but there is no language explicitly addressing AI-generated content. Alan Wilson, who is expected to run for governor in 2026, wants to close the loopholes to make it easier to go after people trying to feed the child porn market.

articles.title: An OpenAI social network: It's all about user attention and human-generated data
articles.summary: Elon Musk's new AI startup, OpenAI, wants to create its own social network. Bill Gross, the founder of tech incubator Idealab, says there are two main reasons why OpenAI would want to do that: attention and data. OpenAI needs more attention to justify its valuation.

articles.title: An OpenAI social network: It's all about user attention and human-generated data
articles.author: Alistair Barr
articles.summary: OpenAI plans to launch a social network, according to a media report on Tuesday. Elon Musk transformed X and xAI by protecting his social network's data and using it to create new AI services. Sam Altman doesn't like Musk, so why not start competing head-on with X? OpenAI is looking for attention and data.

articles.title: Sam Altman's play for a social network could get him data — and under Elon Musk's skin
articles.author: Alistair Barr
articles.summary: OpenAI plans to launch a social network, according to a media report on Tuesday. Elon Musk transformed X and xAI by protecting his social network's data and using it to create new AI services. Sam Altman doesn't like Musk, so why not start competing head-on with X? OpenAI is looking for attention and data.

articles.title: ChatGPT Is Already the Most Downloaded App in the World. The Only Problem Is It Doesn't Know How to Make Money From Its Popularity
articles.summary: ChatGPT was the most downloaded app in the world in March. It had 13 million downloads on iOS and 33 million on Android. It's the first time in 12 years that a social media platform didn't claim the No. 1 spot. Instagram also had around 46 million downloads.

articles.title: Is Meta Platforms (META) the Best Machine Learning Stock to Buy Now?
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: The global machine-learning market was valued at $36.73 billion in 2022. It's expected to grow at a 34.8% CAGR from 2023 to 2030. Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) offers products that enable people to connect and share with friends and family through devices like phones, personal computers, and wearables. It uses machine learning for content personalization and ad targeting on social media platforms and for developing AI for metaverse. Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated an Overweight rating on the company with a $790 price target.

articles.title: OpenAI Eyes Social Network to Rival Elon Musk's X
articles.author: Yoel Beinart
articles.summary: OpenAI is exploring a social media platform to rival X and Instagram. Its March-launched image-generation tool has overwhelmed its servers. The company secured a record $40 billion funding round last month at a $300 billion valuation. Elon Musk's X was recently acquired by his AI venture xAI.

articles.title: OpenAI Developing Social App as Rivalry With Musk Heats Up
articles.author: Muslim Farooque
articles.summary: OpenAI, the artificial intelligence company backed by Microsoft, is working on a social media platform built around its generative AI technology, according to The Verge. It's not clear if the project will launch as a new app or be folded into the existing ChatGPT platform. Elon Musk is suing the company and Microsoft.

articles.title: Is Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) Among the Best Machine Learning Stocks to Buy Now?
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: The global machine-learning market is expected to grow at a 34.8% CAGR from 2023 to 2030. Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA) ranks 8th on our list of the 10 best machine learning stocks to buy now. Amazon CEO Andy Jassy believes AI deployment still requires significant investment.

articles.title: Adobe makes a strategic bet on AI-generated video with an investment in Synthesia
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Adobe has invested in British AI startup Synthesia. It lets users create videos with lifelike avatars and voiceovers in 140+ languages. CNBC confirmed that Adobe is building the world's leading AI video platform for enterprise and Synthesias investment validates that direction.

articles.title: We turned ourselves into action figures using AI. Here's how it went.
articles.author: Greta Cross
articles.summary: As part of the "Barbie Box Challenge," social media users are sharing photos of themselves with a specific-worded prompt to OpenAI's ChatGPT in hopes of receiving a custom digital doll that looks just like them. The new trend comes less than a month after OpenAI launched its new image generator, GPT-4o. USA TODAY used the software to create its own journalist dolls.

articles.title: Santa Clara politicians turn to ChatGPT for advice
articles.author: B. Sakura Cannestra
articles.summary: Santa Clara officials used ChatGPT to look for possible holes in legal contracts regarding the FIFA 2026 World Cup games at a Feb. 11 meeting. Mayor Lisa Gillmor used it to research possible competitors to merchandiser Fanatics during a March 11 meeting and she liked it. Councilmember Kevin Park, an engineer in multiple AI companies, said most people don't understand how AI technologies work. Mindy Romero, director for the University of Southern California's Center for Inclusive Democracy, said AI technologies are advancing fast and need to be carefully managed.

articles.title: Five things you should never reveal to ChatGPT if you want to protect your privacy
articles.author: Brooke Steinberg
articles.summary: ChatGPT has a 'Temporary Chat' mode which acts in a similar manner to an internet browser's incognito mode. Don't reveal any identifying information to ChatGPT or an AI chatbot, such as your Social Security number, driver's license and passport numbers, date of birth, address and phone numbers. Never reveal your bank and investment account numbers as they can be hacked.

articles.title: AI Focus Shifting From Infrastructure to Services
articles.author: Stephen McBride
articles.summary: Stephen McBride is Chief Analyst, RiskHedge. He uses AI chatbots Claude, Grok and ChatGPT at least 50 times daily as his research assistant, writing partner, and instant answer machine at work. He's taught his kids how to use AI.

articles.title: Anthropic is reportedly launching a voice AI you can speak to
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Anthropic is getting ready to introduce a new 'voice mode' within its Claude AI chatbot. The feature will rival OpenAI's similar option within ChatGPT. Anthropic plans to roll out three English-language voices called Airy, Mellow, and Buttery.

articles.title: Loti AI Announces $16.2M Series A Funding Round Led By Khosla Ventures
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Loti AI announces the close of their $16.2M Series A funding led by Khosla Ventures with additional investments from FUSE, Bling Capital, Ensemble, Alpha Edison, and K5 Tokyo Black. This builds on Loti AI's previous seed round of $6.65M in 2024.

articles.title: OpenAI wants to be more than an AI company
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: Sam Altman wants OpenAI to be a sprawling consumer tech company, not just an AI lab. The Verge reports that OpenAI has been working on an internal prototype of a social network that would let people share their AI-generated images. ChatGPT was released in November 2022 and has become a huge success. Altman has been busy adding new features and services to the chatbot.

articles.title: Social networks are vulnerable to relatively simple AI manipulation and polarization
articles.author: Patrick Lejtenyi
articles.summary: Concordia researchers developed a new method of maximizing online polarization using artificial intelligence. Their research was published in the journal IEEE Xplore. They used data from 4 million accounts on the social media network Twitter with opinions on the topic of vaccines and vaccination. The researchers hope their work will influence policymakers and platform owners to develop new safeguards against malicious manipulation by malicious agents.

articles.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT will fix the worst thing about Netflix
articles.summary: Netflix is testing an AI-powered search feature in Australia and New Zealand. The feature is opt-in, so users in those markets would have to enable it. It's early days for the feature and it's only working in iOS for the time being.

articles.title: How AI can help to detect oil spills at sea
articles.summary: Norwegian marine data specialists, the Miros Group, are using AI to assess the state of the sea around offshore installations. The company uses traditional maritime radars to create an image of sea's surface. That's analyzed by AI and used to assess wave measurements. Miros says its technology can be used to predict future sea states.

articles.title: OpenAI is reportedly making its own social network to rival X
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: According to a report from The Verge, OpenAI is in the early stages of creating its own social network to rival Facebook and X. The report claims that the AI company is currently experimenting with an internal prototype of such a social network.    .

articles.title: Contrariwise: Stick to Your (Analog) Guns
articles.author: Andy Hollandbeck
articles.summary: There is a rush to integrate artificial intelligence into every type of product these days. The current trend toward all-A.I. all the time probably won't end until we see the next big technological advance-turned-gimmick that must be incorporated into everyday products.

articles.title: OpenAI considering its own social network to compete with Elon Musk's X
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: OpenAI is considering building a social network to compete with Elon Musk's X and Meta's Instagram. The project is still in its early stages. OpenAI's newest image-generation feature has led to an overloading of the company's servers. Elon Musk and Sam Altman are involved in a legal battle.

articles.title: OpenAI Charts Course Toward AI-Integrated Social Platform
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: OpenAI is developing a social networking platform inspired by X. It is aiming to integrate AI functionalities directly into the user experience. This move signals the company's intent to diversify beyond its core AI initiatives.       i.An.

articles.title: Former Core Developer Believes Ethereum Holds The Key To AI Decentralization
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is opening up a vast realm of possibilities for developers working on the Ethereum blockchain by leveraging AI technology, according to Menafn.    Menafn is the name of the game show on which the show is based.

articles.title: Study cracks the code behind why AI behaves as it does
articles.author: George Washington University
articles.summary: George Washington University researchers used physics to dissect and explain the attention mechanism at the core of AI systems. The research is published on the arXiv preprint server. The analysis could lead to solutions that would make AI safer, more trustworthy and resistant to manipulation.

articles.title: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR): Powers NATO with Maven Smart System
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is a leading provider of artificial intelligence systems. It is 10th on Insider Monkey's list of AI stocks to watch amid market volatility. The list is based on news articles, stock analysis, and press releases.

articles.title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL): Turning AI Talk into Grid Action
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) ranks 3rd on our list of AI stocks to watch amid market volatility. Seven Republican senators have sent a letter to U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick to get rid of a Biden administration rule that restricts global access to AI chips.

articles.title: Former Colorado Springs resident changing the future of sound design with the power of AI
articles.author: Breeanna Jent
articles.summary: Isaiah Chavous and James Paul co-founded Noctal, an online platform that uses artificial intelligence to improve the quality of sound design in films, video and other content. Noctal has already raised $1.8 million and will launch in Los Angeles later this year.

articles.title: ChatGPT for taxes? OpenAI and H&R Block have a plan for tax pros
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: OpenAI and H&R Block are working together to develop a new generative artificial intelligence tool for tax professionals. The goal is to help them stay up to date on tax code changes and to more quickly answer "the most gnarly questions that walk through the door". The new product will be powered by vetted data from The Tax Institute. The project's initial phase should launch later this year, followed by a large-scale deployment ahead of the 2026 tax season.

articles.title: AI in Action: How companies are applying artificial intelligence innovations
articles.author: Insider Inc.
articles.summary: Business Insider's series "AI in Action" examines how organizations are integrating AI into the workplace through employee feedback and training, data-security procedures, financial strategies, and more. Diligent collaboration is key to making AI a functional part of workers' lives.

articles.title: A series exploring how companies are implementing AI innovations
articles.summary: Business Insider's series "AI in Action" examines how organizations are integrating AI into the workplace through employee feedback and training, data-security procedures, financial strategies, and more. Diligent collaboration is key to making AI a functional part of workers' lives.

articles.title: Google to mash Gemini Live with another popular AI feature
articles.author: Arthur Brown
articles.summary: Gemini Live could be getting a feature similar to Circle to Search. This is still in an early build and not available to the public. Google I/O is around the corner, so we might hear more about this feature then.   .

articles.title: OpenAI is reportedly making its own social network to rival X
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: According to a report, OpenAI is developing a social network based on ChatGPT's image generation and featuring a social feed. Sam Altman has been asking for feedback about the project from outside of the company. Elon Musk is rumoured to be interested in investing in the project.

articles.title: AI industry ‘timelines' to human-like AGI are getting shorter. But AI safety is getting increasingly short shrift
articles.author: Jeremy Kahn
articles.summary: AI timelines are getting shorter and so is the amount of attention that AI labs are paying to AI safety. Competition between AI companies is getting more intense. The U.S. sees AGI as a strategic technology and wants to get ahead of China in the race to develop it.

articles.title: A Fully AI Powered Hotel In Las Vegas Has Started Taking Orders, Promising The Ultimate User Experience
articles.author: Jeff Vasishta
articles.summary: The Otonomus Hotel in Las Vegas has started taking bookings for its Jul. 1 opening. It promises a streamlined and personalized user experience, allowing guests to choose what kind of coffee and towels they prefer. According to a recent survey, 77% of respondents plan to allocate between 5% and 50% of their IT budgets toward AI tools in the coming year. The market for hospitality robots is projected to reach $65.4 billion by 2032.

articles.title: Claude just gained superpowers: Anthropic's AI can now search your entire Google Workspace without you
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Anthropic launched major upgrades to its Claude AI assistant today, introducing an autonomous research capability and Google Workspace integration. The expansion directly challenges OpenAI and Microsoft in the increasingly competitive market for AI productivity tools. Anthropic emphasizes its security-first approach, particularly for the Google Drive Catalog feature.

articles.title: Anthropic's Claude AI can now search your Gmail inbox for you
articles.author: Martyn Landi
articles.summary: Claude, the high-powered AI assistant from start-up Anthropic, can now be linked with Google's Gmail and Calendar to help with organisation tasks. Anthropic is backed by investment from both Google and Amazon. Google announced it was launching a new AI video generation tool within its Gemini Advanced AI assistant tool.

articles.title: Anthropic launches research tool and Google Workspace integration
articles.author: Kylie Robison
articles.summary: Anthropic is launching two major features today: Research and Google Workspace integration. Claude can now connect directly to Gmail, Google Calendar, and Documents. Anthropic is also rolling out 'Google Drive cataloging' for Enterprise customers. The Research function is available now in early beta for Max, Team, and Enterprise plans in the United States, Japan, and Brazil.

articles.title: Take our survey: Help KXAN understand how journalists should disclose use of AI
articles.author: Kate Winkle
articles.summary: KXAN is one of 10 newsrooms selected to test artificial intelligence tools as part of a partnership with Trusting News. KXAN wants to be transparent with its audience and disclose any time it uses a generative artificial intelligence tool that contributes to the work its audience sees or reads.

articles.title: OpenAI is building an X-like social media network
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: OpenAI is working on its own X-like social media network. The project is still in early stages and there is an internal prototype focused on ChatGPT's image generation that contains a social feed. CEO Sam Altman has been privately asking outsiders for feedback about the project.

articles.title: Health Prepping: Did AI Just Cut Cancer Risk by 90%?
articles.author: John Rubino
articles.summary: Doctors Justus R. Hope and Paul E. Marik asked an AI to look through all available studies involving supplements' impact on cancer risk. They found EGCG, Curcumin and Vitamin D supplements that reduced cancer risk by 60%. They improved on this with Metformin, Ivermectin, and Mebendazole to reduce risk to 70-80%.

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI deserves to be mocked for its confusing AI names — and a ‘fix' is coming
articles.summary: OpenAI's AI models are called GPT-4.1, o1 mini and ChatGPT. CEO Sam Altman wants to change the naming conventions by this summer. Chief product officer Kevin Weil thinks the current naming convention is 'atrocious' and 'not the most important thing'.

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI deserves to be mocked for its confusing AI names — and an overhaul is coming
articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: Sam Altman wants to change the name of OpenAI's AI models as soon as this summer. Chief product officer Kevin Weil also dislikes the company's naming conventions. The new family of AI models, GPT-4.1 nano, are only available through the API.

articles.title: A-1 Steak Sauce Responds To Linda McMahon's Stupidity
articles.author: John Amato
articles.summary: Donald Trump's Education Secretary, Linda McMahon, called artificial intelligence A1 steak sauce during a conference last week. John Oliver quipped, "I am team A-1 Steak Sauce." Rachel Maddow had a field day with it and so did John Oliver.

articles.title: 85 pc Indian students, educators believe availability and volume of AI overwhelming: Survey
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: 85 pc Indian students, educators believe availability and volume of AI overwhelming, according to a survey.      Â   for the survey. For more information, visit: http://www.indianacademy.org/sensory-assessment.

articles.title: Why Meta wants to tilt its AI to the right
articles.author: MSNBC
articles.summary: New York Magazine's John Herrman joins Morning Joe to discuss his latest piece 'Meta Wants to Tilt Its AI to the Right' April 15, 2025.    .   "Meta W wants to tilt its AI to a right".

articles.title: The Current State Of The AI Market: The AI Divide
articles.author: S. M. Saifee Islam
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has rapidly emerged as one of the most transformative and fast-growing technologies globally. According to Grand View Research, the market is projected to grow exponentially, reaching $1.81 trillion by 2030. UNCTAD reports that the industry could reach $4.8 trillion by 2033, a 25-fold increase from its 2023 valuation of $189 billion. AI development remains heavily concentrated in a few advanced economies, especially the U.S. and China. This concentration of innovation, resources, and talent raises concerns about a widening global divide. Developing countries must lead with strategies that position them as creators of digital innovation.

articles.title: AI in crypto: How Walbi outshines KuCoin and Bybit with smarter trading tools
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: Walbi is making AI tools usable for everyday traders in the crypto industry thanks to his partnership with partner content provider, Partner Content.    .      in the company's website:  #partnercontent.com/content/Walbi.

articles.title: Building a foundation with AI to jumpstart your journalism
articles.author: Muskan Bansal
articles.summary: Only 36% of journalists are comfortable consuming news made by humans with the help of AI. News publishers believe artificial intelligence will be most important for increasing back-end efficiency and automation in 2025. Google's NotebookLM is an AI research assistant that analyzes source material such as research articles, interview transcripts, data visualizations, images and web URLs.
